alert.note: Alert for Boulder And Jefferson Counties Below 6000 Feet, West Broomfield County; Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Central and South Weld County; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County; Logan County; Morgan County; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County; Northeast Weld County; Phillips County; Sedgwick County; Washington County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 17 at 6:57PM MST until January 18 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...WINTER STORM TO BRING IMPACTFUL SNOW THROUGH WEDNESDAY... .A storm system will bring snow and deteriorating road conditions to northeast Colorado beginning this afternoon in the mountains, and this evening for the urban corridor and plains. Snow will be heavy at times overnight and into early Wednesday morning, then taper off in the afternoon from west to east. Expect difficult overnight travel, with treacherous conditions continuing through Wednesday. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow ongoing, with total snow accumulations between 6 and 12 inches expected. Localized totals of 12 to 15 inches possible, mainly east of I-25 and in the northeast plains. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph east of I-25 with some blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...Portions of east central, north central, and northeast Colorado. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 5 PM MST Wednesday. Heaviest snow expected overnight. * IMPACTS...Snow covered roads will make travel very difficult due to heavy snowfall on roadways. The hazardous conditions may impact the tail end of the Tuesday evening commute and will greatly impact the Wednesday morning commute.
info.instruction: Persons should delay travel if possible. If travel is necessary, drive with extreme caution and be prepared for sudden changes in visibility. Leave plenty of room between you and the motorist ahead of you, and allow extra time to reach your destination. Avoid sudden braking or acceleration, and be especially cautious on hills or when making turns. Make sure your car is winterized and in good working order. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.
